result.execSummary:
The defendant Antavius Isaiah Lester was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 6/26/16, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antavius Isaiah Lester

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Commitment paid in full and faxed to Sheriff's office.
F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay.  10 days HOC, consecutive.  Due & owing
Also referenced ATN #41004209212029, arrest date 3-1-14, MPD7.

Defendant Antavius Isaiah Lester in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Antavius Isaiah Lester in custody.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served. 

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 6/26/2016, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Attorney Stephen A Sargent in court, defendant Antavius Isaiah Lester not in court, in custody.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/26/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Defense counsel to inform the state if the defendant is revoked so that they can do an order to produce the defendant for the next court date.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel needs time to talk with the defendant.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/14/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-26-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antavius Isaiah Lester in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Antavius Isaiah Lester in custody.  Antonella Aleman, appearing for Stephan Nolten, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 3.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Antavius Isaiah Lester in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Antavius Isaiah Lester in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
